catchphrase: Delayed due to COVID-19. HalfStack Vienna will return in 2023 at Ankersaal near the Hauptbahnhof.
description: Up to 200 Front-end / Web / JavaScript / Mobile / IoT developers and decision makers
Mostly from the Vienna area, with some from throughout the Europe, the UK, and the US
faqs: If you're not from Vienna, note that HalfStack Vienna is near the HbF (main train station). Vienna has many hotels and Airbnb options that are well connected via subways, trains, and buses.
schedule: Plan to arrive between 09:00 and 09:30 on the 15th of September & stay late for an amazing day of JavaScript goodness!

description: Join Mynah Marie (aka Earth to Abigail) for an interactive session where we will explore the world of live coding music through the browser using the web platform Estuary. As a seasoned live coder and passionate musician, Mynah will guide attendees through the fundamentals of live coding music, breaking down complex concepts into accessible steps. Everyone is encouraged to get their laptops out and actively participate. Throughout the session, we will delve into Estuary’s features and languages. Participants will gain first-hand experience on what it’s like to use code as a performing arts medium and what kind of challenges live coders face when creating music or visuals in real time. Prepare to be amazed as the collective creativity of CityJS + HalfStack unfolds in this unique group experience!
sessions.title: Live Coding Together in the Browser Using Estuary

description: Is it possible to connect IT with philosophy? Yes, it is, let's talk about it!
Let's connect philosophy and IT by use stoic principles during automation testing. We will explore how to use stoic philosophy during the daily work of automation QA engineers on real examples.
Stoic philosophy isn’t just boring ancient theory which we know from school subjects, but a real self-development program which can be applied in modern life and in IT
sessions.title: How popovers are about to become a whole lot easier to build

description: Our design systems commonly feature components that show on top of other content: tooltips, date pickers, menus and teaching UI, to name just a few. Proposed updates to the web platform are about to make building these a whole lot easier. You might not even need JavaScript. You’ll learn all about the upcoming ‘popover’ attribute, modality and the top layer.
sessions.title: Stoic Philosophy and Automation Testing

description: Bogomil's career in IT started as a servant to programmers: fixing a line or two in the code, and now he is a Director in a vast international privacy company. When he looks back, it was different. Oh gosh, we had so much fun in the past.
It seems that at some point recently, most of the world decided that IT is an elite profession that needs to produce only value no matter what.

This is a great tragedy, and it must be rectified. Why do we have feelings, emotions, and personalities if we no longer have fun? In this talk, we'll take a retrospective journey through the years to what went wrong and how we fix it together.
We will cover the epoch of the world before Agile to the era of the Artificial Immigrant(AI), who is here to take your jobs away.
sessions.title: Where did all the fun go?
